revision.text:
''For other uses, see [[Toad (disambiguation)]]''
{{Infobox software | name = TOAD | logo = | screenshot = | caption = | author = [[Quest Software]] | latest release version = 11.5 <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.adfontessoftware.nl/nw-23917-7-3397150/nieuws/toad_for_oracle_115_released.html|title=TOAD for Oracle 11.5 released}}</ref> | latest release date = {{Start date and age|2012|04|25}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | operating system = [[Windows]] | platform = | language = | status = | genre = Database management/development | license = | website = http://www.quest.com/toad }} '''T'''ool for '''O'''racle '''A'''pplication '''D'''evelopers (TOAD) is a [[software application]] from [[Dell Software]] used for development and [[database administration|administration]] of various [[relational database]]s using [[SQL]].<ref>[http://www.toadsoft.com/ Official Toad site]</ref>
== Supported databases and environments == Toad supports the following relational databases: [[Oracle Database]], [[Microsoft SQL Server]], [[Sybase]], [[IBM DB2]], and [[MySQL]]. In 2009, Toad for Cloud Databases was released to offer support for the following non-relational databases: [[Hadoop]], [[mongoDB]], [[SimpleDB]], [[Azure Services Platform]], and [[Apache Cassandra]]. Toad runs on all [[32-bit]] [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] platforms, including [[Windows 95]], [[Windows 98|98]], [[Windows NT|NT]], [[Windows 2000|2000]], [[Windows XP|XP]], and [[Windows Vista|Vista]]. For [[backend]] connectivity Toad needs Oracle 32-bit SQL*Net and Oracle version 7.3.4 or later.
Toad can view the [[Oracle data dictionary]] - [[Table (database)|tables]], [[Index (database)|indexes]], [[stored procedure]]s - and do various other tasks through multi-tabbed browsers.
Toad does not support any non-[[Microsoft]] environment. Starting from 2005-02-17, TOra, an [[open source]] [[platform independent]] tool offering some of Toad's basic functionality, is fully maintained by the community.<ref>https://sourceforge.net/projects/tora/forums/forum/52736/topic/1130286</ref><ref>http://sourceforge.net/projects/tora/forums/forum/52736/topic/1231653</ref>
Dell makes Toad available in both commercial and trial/[[freeware]] versions. Freeware is available from the ToadWorld.com community<ref>http://www.toadworld.com</ref>
== History == [[Jim McDaniel]] (aka "TOADman"), a practicing Oracle developer, originally designed Toad for his own use in the late 1990s.<ref> {{cite book | last = Scalzo | first = Bert | last1 = Hotka | first1 = Dan | others = Jim McDaniel | title = Toad Handbook | url = http://books.google.com/books?id=eKwSVQ7kiaIC
| accessdate = 2013-03-05 | series = Developer's Library | year = 2003 | month = February | publisher = [[SAMS Publishing | Sams Publishing]] | isbn = 9780672324864 | page = xiv | quote = I've been working on TOAD now for more than six years. Or has it been seven? }} </ref> He called it ''Tool for Oracle Application Developers'': "TOAD" for short. McDaniel made the tool available to others first as [[shareware]] and later as [[freeware]], distributing it freely over the [[Internet]].
As the user base grew, so did the effort of maintenance and development. Finally, the author realized that he could no longer dedicate substantial amounts of time to the growing quantity of software enhancement requests.
Quest Software, established in 1987, acquired TOAD in October 1998<ref> {{cite web |url = http://www.quest.com/company/acquisitions.aspx |title = Quest Software's Acquisitions |publisher = Dell Inc. |accessdate = 2013-03-05 }} </ref> and became part of Dell in September 2012<ref name="About Quest Software – now a part of Dell">{{cite web|title=About Quest Software – now a part of Dell|url=http://www.quest.com/company/}}</ref>
== Books == * ''Toad Pocket Reference for Oracle 1st Edition'' by Jim McDaniel and Patrick McGrath, O'Reilly, 2002 (ISBN 0596003374, ISBN 978-0-596-00337-1) * ''Toad Pocket Reference for Oracle 2nd Edition'' by Jeff Smith, Bert Scalzo, and Patrick McGrath, O'Reilly, 2005 (ISBN 0596009712, ISBN 978-0-596-00971-7) * ''TOAD Handbook'' by Bert Scalzo and Dan Hotka, Sams, 2003 (ISBN 0672324865, ISBN 978-0-672-32486-4) * ''TOAD Handbook 2nd Edition'' by Bert Scalzo and Dan Hotka, Addison-Wesley Professional, 2009 (ISBN 0321649109, ISBN 978-0-321-64910-2)
==References== <references />
